item.name: TC-01. Verify the title length is within the valid range of 3 to 50 characters
TC-02. Verify Title length is greater than the Valid Maximum length of 50 characters
TC-03. Verify that the body length is greater than 200 characters.
TC-04. Verify that the combined length of title and body is within the required range (e.g., 3-250 characters).
TC-05. Verify valid type field
TC-06. Verify Invalid type Field
TC-07. Verify Non-Integer type Field
TC-08. Verify valid input combination
TC-09. Verify invalid input combination
TC-10. Verify Missing Required Fields
TC-11.  Verify Response for Invalid JSON Syntax
TC-12. Verify the response for invalid data types for all 3 parameters

exec: // Test: Check the status code is 201
pm.expect(responseData.title.length).to.be.within(0, 50, "Title length must be between 0 and 50 characters");
pm.expect(responseData.body.length).to.be.within(0, 200, "Body length must be between 0 and 200 characters");

info.name: Postman Test Automation for Mock API

description.content:
I created 12 test cases using the test design techniques below in order to cover some test scenarios. Reference link for these techniques; [https://www.istqb.org/certifications/certified-tester-foundation-level](https://www.istqb.org/certifications/certified-tester-foundation-level)

**1 . Black-Box Techniques:**  
a. Equivalence Partitioning – 3 Test cases; TC-01, 02, 03,  
b. Boundary Value Analysis – 4 Test cases; TC-04, 05, 06, 07,  
c. Decision Table Testing – 2 Test cases; TC-08, 09,  

**2.Experience-Based Techniques**  
a. Exploratory Testing – 3 test cases; TC-10, 11, 12.

**Test Case Overview**  
I added test scripts within the post-response section of the project to incorporate logic that validates the input fields of the Mock API. This ensures the POST request is properly validated, and the test cases accurately determine whether they pass or fail.

item.name: TC-01. Verify the title length is within the valid range of 3 to 50 characters
TC-02. Verify Title length is greater than the Valid Maximum length of 50 characters

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Title length must be between 0 and 50 characters: expected 79 to be within 0..50
error.stack:
AssertionError: Title length must be between 0 and 50 characters: expected 79 to be within 0..50
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:2:2)

item.name: TC-03. Verify that the body length is greater than 200 characters.

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Body length must be between 0 and 200 characters: expected 254 to be within 0..200
error.stack:
AssertionError: Body length must be between 0 and 200 characters: expected 254 to be within 0..200
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:3:3)

item.name: TC-04. Verify that the combined length of title and body is within the required range (e.g., 3-250 characters).
TC-05. Verify valid type field
TC-06. Verify Invalid type Field

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Type should be a number: expected '$$$' to be a number
error.stack:
AssertionError: Type should be a number: expected '$$$' to be a number
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:4:6)

item.name: TC-07. Verify Non-Integer type Field

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Type should be a number: expected '' to be a number
error.stack:
AssertionError: Type should be a number: expected '' to be a number
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:4:7)

item.name: TC-08. Verify valid input combination
TC-09. Verify invalid input combination

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Body length must be between 0 and 200 characters: expected 254 to be within 0..200
error.stack:
AssertionError: Body length must be between 0 and 200 characters: expected 254 to be within 0..200
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:3:9)

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Type should be a number: expected [] to be a number
error.stack:
AssertionError: Type should be a number: expected [] to be a number
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:4:9)

item.name: TC-10. Verify Missing Required Fields

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Type should be a number: expected '' to be a number
error.stack:
AssertionError: Type should be a number: expected '' to be a number
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:4:10)

item.name: TC-11.  Verify Response for Invalid JSON Syntax

error.name: JSONError
error.message:
Unexpected token 'S' at 1:1
SyntaxError: Unexpected string in JSON at position 102
^

item.name: TC-12. Verify the response for invalid data types for all 3 parameters

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Title should be a string: expected 658 to be a string
error.stack:
AssertionError: Title should be a string: expected 658 to be a string
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:2:12)

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Body should be a string: expected false to be a string
error.stack:
AssertionError: Body should be a string: expected false to be a string
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:3:12)

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Type should be a number: expected 'great work' to be a number
error.stack:
AssertionError: Type should be a number: expected 'great work' to be a number
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:4:12)

error.name: AssertionError
error.message: Title length must be between 0 and 50 characters: expected 79 to be within 0..50
error.stack:
AssertionError: Title length must be between 0 and 50 characters: expected 79 to be within 0..50
   at Object.eval sandbox-script.js:2:2)

source.name: TC-02. Verify Title length is greater than the Valid Maximum length of 50 characters

item.name: TC-01. Verify the title length is within the valid range of 3 to 50 characters
TC-02. Verify Title length is greater than the Valid Maximum length of 50 characters
TC-03. Verify that the body length is greater than 200 characters.
TC-04. Verify that the combined length of title and body is within the required range (e.g., 3-250 characters).
TC-05. Verify valid type field
TC-06. Verify Invalid type Field
TC-07. Verify Non-Integer type Field
TC-08. Verify valid input combination
TC-09. Verify invalid input combination

exec: // Test: Check the status code is 201
pm.expect(responseData.title.length).to.be.within(0, 50, "Title length must be between 0 and 50 characters");
pm.expect(responseData.body.length).to.be.within(0, 200, "Body length must be between 0 and 200 characters");

info.name: Postman Test Automation for Mock API

description.content:
I created 12 test cases using the test design techniques below in order to cover some test scenarios. Reference link for these techniques; [https://www.istqb.org/certifications/certified-tester-foundation-level](https://www.istqb.org/certifications/certified-tester-foundation-level)

**1 . Black-Box Techniques:**  
a. Equivalence Partitioning – 3 Test cases; TC-01, 02, 03,  
b. Boundary Value Analysis – 4 Test cases; TC-04, 05, 06, 07,  
c. Decision Table Testing – 2 Test cases; TC-08, 09,  

**2.Experience-Based Techniques**  
a. Exploratory Testing – 3 test cases; TC-10, 11, 12.

**Test Case Overview**  
I added test scripts within the post-response section of the project to incorporate logic that validates the input fields of the Mock API. This ensures the POST request is properly validated, and the test cases accurately determine whether they pass or fail.
